From what I've read about low dose asprin therepy you should start taking them before conception to increase the thickness of the uterine lining and prevent clotting once implantation occurs. I guess asprin crosses the placenta easily so I would assume you wouldn't take it long after your pregnancy is confirmed.The only other time I've heard of it being used in pregnancy is in the treatment of preeclampsia. I'd check with your doctor because you're taking it in conjunction with the clomid to make sure you're getting the desired effects of the two together. Good luck to you!

Hi hon, first I would really talk to your doctor about this. Taking asprin as a regiment is always followed up with monitoring from your doctor. That is anytime you do it. And especially while TTC. That being said I took it for the first three months of my pregnanct due to clotting issues. I had had two miscarriages and doctor wanted to make sure that the baby implanted correctly.Again please call your doctor before you start taking this especially with a fertility drug that thins your lining anyway.I pray you get your miracle soon. Sending you lots of baby dust.Christine

I started taking baby aspirin after my first miscarriage.  My fertility doctor said that some m/c are caused by tiny blood clots in the umbilical cord.  The aspirin keeps the flow going.  After the miscarriage he had me on them from day one until my delivery of my son.  I hope this help.maria
